intro: Phacelia magellanica var. pinnata, commonly known as the Magellanic pinnate phacelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a distinctive, fern-like appearance. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support pollinator populations.
